intro: Duguetia surinamensis, commonly known as the Surinam bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and are often fragrant. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Duguetia surinamensis thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understorey of tropical forests.
